title: FPS Capped at 60 on Fullscreen and Borderless even with VSYNC OFF!! HELP!!
body:
I am running on Dell Inspiron 3558


GPU: nvidia geforce 920m

CPU: intel core i5-5200u cpu@2.20ghz

Memory: 4gb ram (3.91gb usable)

Resolution: 1920x1080, 59hz

Driver version: 372.54

Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro

Patch 6.16 hehexd


For around 3 days ive been looking for a solution. A few weeks back, I was playing a 1v1 and my fps was like the usual 100+ on low settings, after i got the driver update from nvidia. (I still dont know if this is the cause). My fps started to cap at 60. The in-game settings show that my fps is "UNCAPPED". All of the discussions and suggestions online is for me to turn off V-Sync from nvidia control panel which i have done. I am 100% sure that it is off. I play other games like CS:GO and i have the same problem with fullscreen capping my game at 60fps. But when i change my game to windowed it then works and goes on with the normal fps which is 100+. At first i dont mind playing with 60 capped fps. But in big teamfights, sometimes the fps can drop to 20 below which is very uncomfortable for someone who usually plays with 100+ fps. Ive seen some people say its my monitor only having 60 hz refresh rate, but i dont think its the problem. Ive had this montior for a while and before this issue, ive been playing with this 60hz refresh rate monitor and i was playing on a smooth 100 fps. Please note that this happens to all my games, league of legends ( which i care about the most), and CS:GO. Note: My fps is capped at 60 as if vsync is on, but its actually off. So my fps most of the time stays at 60 and not jumps to 61 or 57 or 58 so its definitely not my rig. Help me out please. Thanks.

replies.body: I found the solution... open the xbox app and turn off dvr, enjoy :)
Dude U are A HEro <3

TY MAN IT WORKS!!!! I'VE BEEN STUCK AT THIS PROBLEM FROM A MONTH. xD
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I don't know how or why this works but it does thank you so much back at 100 fps
THIS WORKS!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!
WTF XBOX GO F WITH YOUR GAMES NOT MINE
THANKS A LOT DUDE
Thank you so much my friend had this problem and we couldnt play but thanks to you we can now play again at ease thanks
EVERYONE THIS WORKS. THANK YOU SO MUCH. SPENT THREE WEEKS TRYING TO SOLVE PROBLEM.

Holy fk thanks alot, that a setting so far burrowed in a PC can have such a impact, thanks alot!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I had the same problem for 2 days. I fixed it by running the game in compatibility mode for windows 7 and also as an administrator. Hope it helps.
thanks a lot man, I couldn't find a solution until I seen you, works like a clock
Worked!!! thx man{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
This worked like a charm, Thanks a lot buddy! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
What about cs:go can i apply the compatibility mode as well?

What happens if you roll back the driver?  If that resolves the issue with your fps then there may be something with the recent update that's messing things up.  Otherwise, go over our [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) issue to rule out possibilities of other factors like hardware or even bad game files.  That should help!

I also tried to roll back the driver and it didnt seem to help no matter how far back i went. I have exactly the same issue and the OP. I did notice if i change the Hz on my monitor the fps in game follows the setting. Hz at 60 the fps is at 60 in game, hz at 50 game drops to 50 fps. Vsync is turned  off in both nvidia control panel as well as the in game options.

I ran into this issue when I reinstalled windows 10 on my PC, previously I did not have the issue on win 10 that I had installed for the past 4 months.
670 GTX
i7 3770k

That should help!

I just tried to roll back the driver, and can ensure you that is not the problem, I have also tried to repair the game which didn't work either. Really don't know what to do atm.
YourLongLostMom you are a hero!!! thank you!!!!!
if it doesn't work go to setting "Update & Security" Then go to "Recovery" and click on the Restore Previous Windows back. this worked for me when the turn xbox dvr off didn't work

Why are you even worried about it? If your screen is only a 60hz refresh rate, then it won't even display more than 60 fps at a time despite what the game says you are running at lol
This is a kappa, right?
Edit: just logged on, High Performance I cant even reach 60 FPS.  Still capped at 60.

Didnt work for me :(.  I had to disable vertical sync to get back to 150-100 fps.  Im surprised tho, my old comp with a 6 year old processor and a shit card ran league at 60 with everything on.  This card does too, but its a 950m and an O5 7200u.  Figured it would play 100 plus fps with everything on

Hi, I had this problem today as well. For months my Asus ran at 250+ fps, then all of a sudden it capped at 60, and played at 30 a lot. Completely unplayable after being used to high fps.

The way I fixed it was to just update all the drivers associated with graphics/video on the asus computer support website for my specific model.
I downloaded a bunch of them and still had league running. when I switched back to my league tab I was at 300+ fps again without even restarting.
hope this helps
Thank you so much for that
i've got same problem my fps Capped at 60 on fullscreen and Fullscreen also on windowed its normal 300 fps i cant fix it can someone help?

I've also got the same problem, but instead of updating the driver I updated my OS from windows 7 to windows 10. I installed all the necessary drivers and tried everything yet nothing worked. PLEASE HELP :(  Fps went from like 200 to 60..
try Window mode, per Laperche above

Hello, I have the same problem here. Windows 10 as well. I found out that the problem is only when you play in fullscreen mode. When you play in window or bordeless mode, you are fine. It is annoying but until the bug is fixed (which will take years) i suggest to play in window mode and use the zoom app from windows 10. You can set it at 125% and focus on keyboard and it is not that bad. It's the best solution i have found so far.. Pretty sketchy

Thanks laperche! Window mode did the trick. Borderless or fullscreen mode capped the FPS at 60. using windows 10 with NVIDIA GTX970M card. Problem started with the last LOL client update. I followed all the LOL troubleshooting recommendations for low FPS, but Window Mode was the only solution.

thanks wrecker
the compatibility mode and administrator thing works, does anyone know how to fix csgo ? its capped at 60 fps and it doesnt allow me to go into games through its master client {{item:3073}}

I'm having the same issue also. It just recently started happening within the last update. I've wasted so much time rolling back drivers and updates trying to fix this. Nothing I do has worked. I really am missing 200 FPS, the difference while playing is vast.
I have excatly the same problem.

Does this work for all the other games
?

PS: I cant login to my microsoft account because of my phone number so i cant turn off dvr on xbox. Any solutions?

Graphics card: 960m (Could be a issue with mobile graphics cards only?)
OS: Windows 10

On windowed mode around 200-300 FPS, once i go to borderless or fullscreen i get 57-60 with some bonus input delay, and i dont want that....
Already turned off vsync both ingame and in the NVIDIA configuration menu, hope this will be looked in to.
